verdict.summary: Calling method/attribute on wrong type or None. Common when function returns None unexpectedly.

dead_ends.action: Add hasattr() check before every access
dead_ends.why_fails: Defensive coding that hides the root cause
Silences real bugs, makes debugging harder

workarounds.action: Trace where the object becomes None/wrong type and fix the source
workarounds.how: Trace where the object becomes None/wrong type and fix the source

workarounds.action: Add type hints and use mypy/pyright to catch statically
workarounds.how: Add type hints and use mypy/pyright to catch statically

leads_to.condition: Same root cause: None where object expected

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'method'' vs 'AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'split'': while both are python errors, the former Calling method/attribute on wrong type or None. Common when function returns Non while the latter Calling a method on None â€” usually from an unhandled function return value or mi.
